channel.title: Really annoying error which keeps causing crashes -.-
channel.description:
I keep getting this error every now and again in runserver.bat even with 1 user on -.-' [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String ind ex out of range: 1 at java.lang.String.getChars(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedWriter.write(Unknown Source) at client.savechar(client.java:23364) at client.process(client.java:11234) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137) at server.main(server.java:50) [/code] I then read a thread on a site and someone said this;
At a guess the last line in the file is a blank line and the returned string is either zero or one character long. Add something like: [code] while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) { if( line.length < 74 ) { // or whatever the max length of a line is System.err.println( "read a line that was too short" ); continue; } [/code] Maybe you don't need to print an error - I don't know what your requirements are. But either way you should verify that you got enough data before trying to do the substring().
Where would i add that?
